item.title: Kilburn Place Street, 20th October
item.description:
I am writing to formally request the installation of additional street lighting on Kilburn Place, as the current lighting is insufficient and leaves the area extremely unsafe, particularly during the evening and night. Due to the lack of adequate lighting, the street has become a hotspot for illegal activities, with squatters frequently using the poorly lit area. These concerns have already been reported to both the police and the council on multiple occasions, yet the issue remains unresolved. Improved lighting would greatly enhance safety for residents and deter further criminal activity.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kilburn Place, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed,nomot,no insurance vehicle, 20th October
item.description:
This vehicle has been in the same position for nearly 2 months despite being reported numerous times by mtself and others. why has it not been removed. it is alsocausing parking problems for both people visiting the woods and residents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castlewood Drive, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: No water drainage, 20th October
item.description:
There are large puddles which form on both the road and pavement at bus stop K on Anerley hill. It's impossible to get from Thicket Road to the bus stop without getting your feet soaked. Also, traffic doesn't slow for the puddles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car taking up multiple parking spaces on residential street with limited parking available., 20th October
item.description:
The car has been left here for multiple weeks on end and it hasnt been moved or returned to. There are now multiple notes from different residents on the windows asking the owner to park more reasonably as its taking up 2 spaces in a street with very limited parking. I have CcTV evidence to prove the dates for how long it has been there without moving.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glen View Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public health risk, 20th October
item.description:
One week ago I reported dangerous slates falling off the roof of the marked premises. I did not get an acknowledgment of this complaint so making it again. something needs to be done here before a passer by is hurt.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powerscroft Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Overflowing rubbish bins spilling into street, 20th October
item.description:
A week later and the same overfilled bins remain spilling into the street with a burst pipe flooding down through them. why is nothing happening? why are we letting foxes and rats root through this on a residential street opposite a school? not cool.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powerscroft Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This very aggressive Jehovah's witness has left a advertisement fly posting, trolley outside on the public walkway abandoned unattended causing obstruction. This aggressive Jehovah's witness always giving dirty looks and displays an aggressive behaviour this is not someone you can go up to and speak to how can he work with God.., 20th October
item.description:
I feel intimidated by this person who works for God. I thought people who work for God are supposed to be respectful kind and nice. to treat all people with the same compassion, care, and respect that you have for yourself trolley need removing.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daintry Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard issue as described below., 20th October
item.description:
Approx 2 1/2 months ago, I reported a bollard that had been knocked into outside 99 Clifton Hill NW8 0JR and was sitting at 45 degrees. I asked for it to be fixed. But all that the Council did was put a huge piece of ugly tarmac into the ground (see photo). Please visit the site to see for yourself. Please can this be properly concreted flush with concrete, not tarmac (!), like it is supposed to be. Awful temporary fix. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 99, Clifton Hill, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture, 20th October
item.description:
There has been a large quantity of household goods dumped on the Course over by the fence which backs onto to houses in the lower half. It looks like a house clearance has been dumped. I believe it may have been done today as I do not recall seeing it this morning but it was there this afternoon.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Course, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet
